thread.title: Morning Sports Update: Roger Goodell said he has no regrets in handling the Deflategate saga - Sports
thread.title_full: Morning Sports Update: Roger Goodell said he has no regrets in handling the Deflategate saga - Sports

author: boston.com
title: Morning Sports Update: Roger Goodell said he has no regrets in handling the Deflategate saga - Sports
text:
When asked if he had regrets from the Deflategate saga, Roger Goodell said, no. The Bruins may need to ride a pair of young stars to the playoffs, and DrafKings won’t fire the employee responsible for the data leak.
Roger Goodell said he has no regrets in handling Deflategate saga: “So our rules and the integrity of our game aren’t because someone’s popular or somebody’s a Super Bowl champ or not,” Goodell continued. “They’re to be applied evenly. Our teams expect that, and that’s our job. That’s our responsibility. That’s my job. And so, no I don’t regret that. And we will continue to uphold the integrity of the game and we’ll do that as vehemently as we can.” ( CBS Boston )
Tom Brady is focusing on his job instead of Greg Hardy’s comments about Gisele: “They count on getting pressure from their front four getting to the quarterback,” Brady said, “so I don’t really care about his personal feelings.” ( Boston.com )
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Are Bruins’ Ryan Spooner, David Pastrnak stars in making? “The projections are a little tougher for Ryan Spooner and David Pastrnak. Between them, the 23-year-old center and 19-year-old right wing have 102 games of NHL experience — a small sample size from which to predict their 2015-16 performance. The nuggets the two forwards have given their employers, however, make their ceilings both high and high out of necessity.” ( The Boston Globe )
Patriots offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels studied coaching under his father, a legendary high school coach: “I got to start to see that at a very early age when I started to go to two-a-day practices when I was five and really got to see that up close and personal. I was kind of a sponge at that point and I fell in love with the game of football through [my dad],” McDaniels said. “I knew real early in my life that this was probably something I wanted to do. I didn’t know what level, but at some point I wanted to be a coach.” ( WEEI.com )
DraftKings CEO won’t fire employee responsible for data leak, insists he runs ‘a very ethical company’: “I don’t care if people give me all kinds of heat for it,” DraftKings cofounder Jason Robins said. “I had so many people tell me the simple thing to do is just fire him. I said, ‘It’s wrong.’” ( The Boston Globe )
Celtics may have floor general in David Lee: “The 32-year-old Lee has quickly emerged as a veteran leader for a young Boston squad, something hammered home when he organized a players-only dinner when the team first arrived in Milan.” ( ESPNBoston.com )
Photo finish: Meet the 2015-16 Boston Celtics
